 1923:     P = spawn(fun () -> receive infinity -> ok end end),
 1924:     erlang:suspend_process(P),
 1925:     exit(P, kill),
 1926:     (catch erlang:resume_process(P)),
 1927:     erl_704_test(N-1).
 1928: 
 1929: ms_excessive_nesting(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1930:     MkMSCond = fun (_Fun, N) when N < 0 -> true;
 1931:                    (Fun, N) -> {'or', {'=:=', N, '$1'}, Fun(Fun, N-1)}
 1932:                end,
 1933:     %% Ensure it compiles with substantial but reasonable
 1934:     %% (hmm...) nesting
 1935:     MS = [{['$1'], [MkMSCond(MkMSCond, 100)], []}],
 1936:     io:format("~p~n", [erlang:match_spec_test([1], MS, trace)]),
 1937:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, MS, []),
 1938:     %% Now test a match spec using excessive nesting. This
 1939:     %% used to seg-fault the emulator due to recursion
 1940:     %% beyond the end of the C-stack.
 1941:     %%
 1942:     %% We expect to get a system_limit error, but don't
 1943:     %% fail if it compiles (someone must have rewritten
 1944:     %% compilation of match specs to use an explicit
 1945:     %% stack instead of using recursion).
 1946:     ENMS = [{['$1'], [MkMSCond(MkMSCond, 1000000)], []}],
 1947:     io:format("~p~n", [erlang:match_spec_test([1], ENMS, trace)]),
 1948:     try
 1949:         _ = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, ENMS, []),
 1950:         {comment, "compiled"}
 1951:     catch
 1952:         error:system_limit ->
 1953:             {comment, "got system_limit"}
 1954:     end.
 1955: 
 1956: drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon) ->
 1957:     drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, false, 0, 0).
 1958: 
 1959: drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, TDRef, N, D) ->
 1960:     case receive Msg -> Msg end of
 1961:         {trace_delivered, Proc, TDRef} ->
 1962:             io:format("~p trace messages on 'DOWN'~n", [D]),
 1963:             io:format("Got a total of ~p trace messages~n", [N]),
 1964:             N;
 1965:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Proc, _} ->
 1966:             Ref = erlang:trace_delivered(Proc),
 1967:             drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, Ref, N, N);
 1968:         Trace when is_tuple(Trace),
 1969:                    element(1, Trace) == trace,
 1970:                    element(2, Trace) == Proc ->
 1971:             drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, TDRef, N+1, D)
 1972:     end.
 1973: 
 1974: tok_trace_loop(_, N, N) ->
 1975:     ok;
 1976: tok_trace_loop(Parent, N, M) ->
 1977:     Name = 'A really stupid name which I will unregister at once',
 1978:     link(Parent),
 1979:     register(Name, self()),
 1980:     unregister(Name),
 1981:     unlink(Parent),
 1982:     tok_trace_loop(Parent, N+1, M).
 1983: 
 1984: %% Waits for and returns the first message in the message queue.
 1985: 
 1986: receive_first() ->
 1987:     receive
 1988:         Any -> Any
 1989:     after 1000 ->
 1990:             timeout
 1991:     end.
 1992: 
 1993: %% Waits for and returns the first message in the message queue.
 1994: 
 1995: receive_first_trace() ->
 1996:     receive
 1997: 	Any when element(1,Any) =:= trace; element(1,Any) =:= trace_ts -> Any
 1998:     after 1000 ->
 1999:             timeout
 2000:     end.
 2001: 
 2002: %% Ensures that there is no message in the message queue.
 2003: 
 2004: receive_nothing() ->
 2005:     receive
 2006:         Any ->
 2007:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, Any})
 2008:     after 100 ->
 2009: 	    ok
 2010:     end.
 2011: 
 2012: 
 2013: %%% Models for various kinds of processes.
 2014: 
 2015: process(Dest) ->
 2016:     receive
 2017:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 2018:             To ! What,
 2019:             process(Dest);
 2020:         {spawn_link_please, ReplyTo, {M, F, A}} ->
 2021:             Pid = spawn_link(M, F, A),
 2022:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, self(), Pid},
 2023:             process(Dest);
 2024:         {spawn_link_please, ReplyTo, Node, {M, F, A}} ->
 2025:             Pid = spawn_link(Node, M, F, A),
 2026:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, self(), Pid},
 2027:             process(Dest);
 2028:         {link_please, Pid} ->
 2029:             link(Pid),
 2030:             process(Dest);
 2031:         {unlink_please, Pid} ->
 2032:             unlink(Pid),
 2033:             process(Dest);
 2034:         {register_please, Name, Pid} ->
 2035:             register(Name, Pid),
 2036:             process(Dest);
 2037:         {unregister_please, Name} ->
 2038:             unregister(Name),
 2039:             process(Dest);
 2040:         {exit_please, Reason} ->
 2041:             exit(Reason);
 2042:         {exit_signal_please, Reason} ->
 2043:             exit(self(), Reason),
 2044:             process(Dest);
 2045:         {trap_exit_please, State} ->
 2046:             process_flag(trap_exit, State),
 2047:             process(Dest);
 2048:         Other ->
 2049:             Dest ! {self(), Other},
 2050:             process(Dest)
 2051:     after 3000 ->
 2052:               exit(timeout)
 2053:     end.
 2054: 
 2055: 
 2056: %% A smart process template.
 2057: 
 2058: process() ->
 2059:     receive
 2060:         {spawn_please, ReplyTo, Fun} ->
 2061:             Pid = fun_spawn(Fun),
 2062:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, Pid},
 2063:             process();
 2064:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 2065:             To ! What,
 2066:             process();
 2067:         timeout_please ->
 2068:             receive after 1 -> process() end;
 2069:         _Other ->
 2070:             process()
 2071:     end.
 2072: 
 2073: 
 2074: %% Sends messages when ordered to.
 2075: 
 2076: sender() ->
 2077:     receive
 2078:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 2079:             To ! What,
 2080:             sender()
 2081:     end.
 2082: 
 2083: 
 2084: %% Just consumes messages from its message queue.
 2085: 
 2086: receiver() ->
 2087:     receiver(infinity).
 2088: 
 2089: receiver(Timeout) ->
 2090:     receiver(receive
 2091: 		 {set_timeout, NewTimeout} -> NewTimeout;
 2092: 		 _Any -> Timeout
 2093: 	     after Timeout -> infinity  %% reset
 2094: 	     end).
 2095: 
 2096: %% Works as long as it receives CPU time.  Will always be RUNNABLE.
 2097: 
 2098: worker() ->
 2099:     worker(0).
 2100: 
 2101: worker(Number) ->
 2102:     worker(Number+1).
 2103: 
 2104: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
 2105:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, []]).
 2106: 
 2107: fun_spawn(Fun, Args) ->
 2108:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, Args]).
 2109: 
 2110: 
 2111: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine) ->
 2112:     case statistics(run_queue) of
 2113:         0 -> true;
 2114:         RQLen ->
 2115:             erlang:display("Waiting for empty run queue"),
 2116:             MSDL = DeadLine*1000,
 2117:             wait_for_empty_runq(MSDL, MSDL, RQLen)
 2118:     end.
 2119: 
 2120: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine, Left, RQLen) when Left =< 0 ->
 2121:     issue_non_empty_runq_warning(DeadLine, RQLen),
 2122:     false;
 2123: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine, Left, _RQLen) ->
 2124:     Wait = 10,
 2125:     UntilDeadLine = Left - Wait,
 2126:     receive after Wait -> ok end,
 2127:     case statistics(run_queue) of
 2128:         0 ->
 2129:             erlang:display("Waited for "
 2130:                            ++ integer_to_list(DeadLine
 2131:                                               - UntilDeadLine)
 2132:                            ++ " ms for empty run queue."),
 2133:             true;
 2134:         NewRQLen ->
 2135:             wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine,
 2136:                                 UntilDeadLine,
 2137:                                 NewRQLen)
 2138:     end.
 2139: 
 2140: issue_non_empty_runq_warning(DeadLine, RQLen) ->
 2141:     PIs = lists:foldl(
 2142:             fun (P, Acc) ->
 2143:                     case process_info(P,
 2144:                                       [status,
 2145:                                        initial_call,
 2146:                                        current_function,
 2147:                                        registered_name,
 2148:                                        reductions,
 2149:                                        message_queue_len]) of
 2150:                         [{status, Runnable} | _] = PI when Runnable /= waiting,
 2151:                                                            Runnable /= suspended ->
 2152:                             [[{pid, P} | PI] | Acc];
 2153:                         _ ->
 2154:                             Acc
 2155:                     end
 2156:             end,
 2157:             [],
 2158:             processes()),
 2159:     io:format("WARNING: Unexpected runnable processes in system (waited ~p sec).~n"
 2160:               "         Run queue length: ~p~n"
 2161:               "         Self: ~p~n"
 2162:               "         Processes info: ~p~n",
 2163:               [DeadLine div 1000, RQLen, self(), PIs]),
 2164:     receive after 1000 -> ok end.
 2165: 
 2166: load_driver(Dir, Driver) ->
 2167:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Dir, Driver) of
 2168:         ok -> ok;
 2169:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 2170:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 2171:             Res
 2172:     end.
